sub_title: CEO at The Eventure Group and Co-Founder at Q-ZN Solutions Inc.
summary:
Steve is co-founder and CEO of The Eventure Group Inc. (www.event-ure.com), an international firm specializing in the conceptualization, creation and management of special events, and is recognized as one of the world’s leading experts in the production of live, virtual and hybrid events.  

In the last eight years, he has produced elaborate events for an impressive roster of corporate clients including Adidas, Bell, Ben & Jerry's, Christian Louboutin, Costco, Ericsson, Formula One, Kia, Automobili Lamborghini, Mattel, Poker Stars and Pfizer - to name but a few. 

His involvement in the production of major fundraising initiatives has raised hundreds of millions of dollars for an array of worthy foundations, including  Cedar's Cancer Institute, the Jewish General Hospital, McGill University and the McGill University Health Centre, the Zuckerberg San Francisco General Hospital Foundation and the Starlight Foundation. 

Steve’s “claim to fame” is his event production involvement with the National Hockey League, having been involved  in the production of the NHL's 2009 All-Star Weekend in Montreal,  2012 All-Star Weekend in Ottawa, 2016 All-Star Weekend in Nashville, 2018 All-Star Weekend in Tampa and 2019 All-Star Weekend In San Jose.

Steve is also co-founder of Q-ZN Solutions (www.q-zn.com), Canada’s most innovative virtual kitchen facility, which he established in 2020 as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic.

Steve's volunteer experience is significant - a pastime he enjoys tremendously.  He has dedicated innumerable hours in support of a variety of admirable causes all across our community.  Currently he sits on the boards of the Dawson College Foundation, Technion Canada and Technion University and is also a volunteer paramedic with the City of Cote Saint-Luc’s Department of Emergency Medical Services.

Steve is married, has a 5 year old son and twin six month old daughters.

treasury_media.description: Avec les nombreuses fermetures des salles à manger, les restaurateurs se sont massivement tournés vers la commande pour emporter et la livraison.

treasury_media.title: Ghost kitchen: New take-out concept creates shared space for restaurants battling pandemic
treasury_media.description: A little more than a year ago, Dory Masri ran four restaurants in Beirut. That changed in August last year, when a massive explosion tore through that city’s port, wreaking destruction in its wake.

treasury_media.title: There’s a Ghost in your Neighbourhood
treasury_media.description: But it’s only the kitchen where you’re dinner is coming from.

treasury_media.title: Brownstein: This ghost kitchen could be a panacea for furloughed chefs
treasury_media.description: Q-ZN featured in the Montreal Gazette.

treasury_media.title: What Q-ZN's arrival on the ghost kitchen scene means for Montreal restaurateurs
treasury_media.description: Over a dozen restaurant concepts will be operating out of the new ghost kitchen warehouse Q-ZN in Ville Saint-Laurent.

treasury_media.title: Q-ZN Launches first location in Quebec Virtual Kitchens to operate in Montreal - Montreal Restaurant Rap Reviews
treasury_media.description: Q-ZN is excited to announce the launch of Quebec’s first Virtual kitchen concept. Located in St Laurent, Q-ZN has begun pre-sales of its delivery-only restaurant concept.

treasury_media.title: Un entrepreneur fonde une coopérative gastronomique
treasury_media.description: Pour l’entrepreneur Dan Vigderhous, ce mantra d’innover ou de périr représente l’essence de son entreprise, une coopérative gastronomique.

treasury_media.title: Sur les traces des cuisines fantômes
treasury_media.description: La pandémie a causé un véritable tremblement de terre qui ébranle les fondations mêmes du modèle traditionnel de restaurant, en plus de propulser la livraison de nourriture vers de nouveaux cieux.

contributors.headline: CEO at The Eventure Group and Co-Founder at Q-ZN Solutions Inc.

profile_positions.description:
Eventure Inc. is a global leader in event-management, always focusing on the needs of our clients. The primary objectives of our corporation are:

- To provide the necessary expertise in managing the client's program from initial concept through completion of the event. 

- To develop and maintain exclusive "Eventeam" partnerships with forward-thinking, energetic and motivated team members and, whenever necessary, suppliers.

- To  provide the highest quality, most efficient service at the lowest possible price.

- To consistently develop original, thoughful and insightful concepts.

- To exceed our client's expectations - always.

- To provide an event that will be remembered as a unique and incredible "Eventure". 

- To maintain a consistent, high level of service. 

- To be fair, honest and ethical in all dealings with our employees, clients and suppliers. 

We're storytellers. Our goal is to help you tell your story better than it's ever been told before. We are an award-winning, full-service production company.  Working with our clients around the world, we're committed to keeping your story fresh, your brand relevant and your business profitable.

We have the finest ideas, people and in-house services to tell your story, offering a true turnkey solution to keep your meeting and event costs down and accountability up.

Dare to Eventure.
profile_positions.title: Chief Events Officer (C.E.O.)

profile_positions.description:
The Canadian Technion Society, founded in 1943, is part of a worldwide family of Technion Societies which provide critical support to the Technion-Israel Institute of Technology, ranked among the world's leading science and technology universities.

The Canadian Technion Society (CTS) is a national organization supported by thousands of members from coast to coast. The CTS has a distinguished record of achievement having helped raise more than $70 million in the past 7 decades.

CTS offers various regional activities to promote philanthropic donations to Technion from individuals, families, foundations and the corporate community; to promote Canadian development and use of Technion educational facilities; to support those researchers and scientists from Canada as well as their counterparts from Technion who are involved in the exchange of scientific information and products of technical research and development. By making available and establishing scholarships, fellowships, lectureships and publications, and through the dissemination of information about Technion, the national and local chapters of the Canadian Technion Society are dedicated to furthering the cause of higher education.

volunteer_experiences.role: Co-Chair - YCC Summer In The City Gala 2014
volunteer_experiences.description:
This new twist on the annual YCC Gala brings an evening of fun and excitement in honour of Phil Levi, CFE, FCPA, FCA, CPA/CFF, FCA-IFA.

Our first annual "Summer In The City" brings summer camp from Huberdeau to Montreal for one night only. Funds raised support two important initiatives:

- A post-camp special needs program for families

- The IVOW (Israeli Victims of War) program, allowing young men and women who have been touched by the tragedy of war to enjoy one month at YCC.

Amount Raised: $98,000.00

volunteer_experiences.role: Board Member and Montreal Council Chair
volunteer_experiences.description:
Technion Canada (formerly The Canadian Technion Society), founded in 1943, is part of a worldwide family of Technion Societies which provide critical support to the Technion-Israel Institute of Technology, ranked among the world's leading science and technology universities.

Technion Canada is a national organization supported by thousands of members from coast to coast and has a distinguished record of achievement having helped raise more than $70 million in the past 7 decades.

Technion Canada offers various regional activities to promote philanthropic donations to Technion from individuals, families, foundations and the corporate community; to promote Canadian development and use of Technion educational facilities; to support those researchers and scientists from Canada as well as their counterparts from Technion who are involved in the exchange of scientific information and products of technical research and development. By making available and establishing scholarships, fellowships, lectureships and publications, and through the dissemination of information about Technion, the national and local chapters of Technion Canada are dedicated to furthering the cause of higher education.

volunteer_experiences.role: Executive Committee Member - Inaugural Gold & Silver Gala
volunteer_experiences.description:
This fundraising gala support of The Duke of Edinburgh’s Young Canadians Challenge and Award. A global youth recognition program, the Award inspires young people to do their very best to achieve their true potential and to contribute in concrete ways to their communities.

The Award already serves over 4,000 Quebec youth, but we have exciting plans to extend its reach and bring young Canadians together in a French immersion environment. One project is a tall ship sailing school on the St. Lawrence River. Another is a whale-watching kayak adventure. Award participants also improve their physical fitness, volunteer in local organizations, and acquire new skills.

You can make a real difference by joining us on Wednesday, October 8 in support of these exciting projects. Our Inaugural Gold & Silver Gala will take place at the beautiful Birks flagship store on Ste. Catherine Street in downtown Montreal. Oliver Jones, Montreal’s world-renowned jazz pianist, composer, and arranger, will perform live at what is sure to be an evening of incredible entertainment and delicious food at an opulent venue!

This year the Town of Hampstead, one of Canada's most affluent communities, celebrates its 100th anniversary.  Hampstead's Centennial Committee is responsible for researching the Town's history and planning all associated projects and events including the Centennial Parade, Centennial Celebration and Centennial Lane. 

Join us in celebrating by exploring Hampstead's interesting history and exciting future...

volunteer_experiences.role: Alternate Member - Technion Board of Governors
volunteer_experiences.description:
Technion is a science and technology research university, among the world’s top ten,
dedicated to the creation of knowledge and the development of human capital and leadership,
for the advancement of the State of Israel and all humanity.

Founded in 1912 in Haifa, Technion is the oldest university in Israel and the Middle East. The university offers degrees in science and engineering, and related fields such as architecture, medicine, industrial management and education.

Technion is noted as a global pioneer in multidisciplinary research into fields including energy, nanotechnology and life science. It has 18 academic departments and 52 research centers and over 13,000 students. Since its founding, it has awarded over 95,000 degrees and its graduates are cited to have brought the unique skills and penchant for innovation which helped conceive and consolidate the modern State of Israel. Technion’s over 610 faculty members include three Nobel Laureates.

In 2011, a successful  bid by a consortium of Cornell University and Technion led to the present estabishment of the Jacobs Technion-Cornell Innovation Institute (JTCII) in New York City. This is the first time any Israeli university has moved into establishing a center of global advanced research in the United States. In 2013, this was followed by another 1st, with the decision to set up a collaborative institute of technology in China in the form of the Technion Guangdong Institute of Technology’ (TGIT).

Technion City generally refers to the 1.2 square kilometer site located on the forested slopes of Mount Carmel and is comprised of over 300 buildings occupied by thousands of people every day. The Technion has two additional campuses. Its historic building in midtown Haifa now houses the Israel National Museum of Science, Technology and Space. The Rappaport Faculty of Medicine is located next to the sea in the neighborhood of Bat Galim, adjacent to Rambam Hospital, the largest medical center in Northern Israel.

volunteer_experiences.role: Emergency Medical Responder, Department of Energency Medical Services

company.name: Ville de Côte Saint-Luc • City of Côte Saint-Luc

volunteer_experiences.description:
Côte Saint-Luc EMS is a unique service that provides emergency response to the population of Côte Saint-Luc.

Each year, EMS volunteers respond to more than 3,000 priority medical calls, arriving on scene within the first few minutes of an emergency and often making the difference between life and death.

The primary function of EMS is to provide first response for life-threatening or serious medical emergencies received through the 9-1-1 system. EMS arrives in the first crucial moments, equipped with an external automated defibrillator (AED), oxygen and airway management supplies, spinal immobilisation equipment, trauma supplies and certain emergency medications. In addition to responding to medical calls, EMS also responds to certain fire calls within the city and is on scene at major events to provide rapid medical treatment to those in need.
